learning_objective: Represent data using multiple encoding schemes.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex loves American football and statistics. They are working on a project to collect and analyze football statistics for their Computer Science course. Alex has data like scores, team names, player information, and duration of games. They want to devise a novel way to represent this data using multiple encoding schemes. Which of the following is unlikely to benefit Alex in effectively presenting the data?",
    "Answer1": "Using scatter plot to show correlation between duration of games and scores.",
    "Answer2": "Using bar chart to show the number of games won by each team.",
    "Answer3": "Using pie chart to show percentage distribution of player positions in a team.",
    "Answer4": "Using a heat map to showcase the computer science concepts used in the project.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "4",
    "Explanation": "While all the options are encoding schemes, a heat map to showcase the computer science concepts used in the project is unlikely to provide meaningful insights relating to the football statistics data."
}
